snippet: Rick Santorum used his speech on Tuesday night, a modified version of the one he has been giving to voters in all 99 counties across Iowa over the last several months, to cast the race as a struggle to allow good to prevail.
abstract: Rick Santorum used his speech on Tuesday night, a modified version of the one he has been giving to voters in all 99 counties across Iowa over the last several months, to cast the race as a struggle to allow good to prevail.
lead_paragraph: JOHNSTON, Iowa -- Rick Santorum often speaks in biblical terms, weaving references to God and Christian faith into his speeches on the campaign trail. Before a national audience on Tuesday night, he offered a glimpse of how large a theme religion will be in his quest for the Republican presidential nomination.

headline.main: Santorum Celebrates Strong Finish in Iowa
